episodeTitle: The Terrifying Banana Gators and Mr. Prince!
episodeTitleJapanese: 恐怖のバナナワニとミスタープリンス
episodeTitleRomanized: Kyōfu no Bananawani to Mistā Purinsu
description: Princess Vivi desperately tries to retrieve a key from the Bananawani enclosure while Crocodile floods his VIP chamber, giving everyone one hour to escape. Sanji, calling himself 'Mr. Prince,' orchestrates a clever plan to rescue his trapped crewmates.

events.title: Koza and Rebels March to Alubarna
events.description: Koza leads the rebel army from Katorea toward Alubarna, the capital of Arabasta, planning to launch an all-out attack. Unaware that Crocodile orchestrated the drought, the rebels believe King Cobra is responsible for their suffering.
events.significance: Sets up the impending clash between the rebels and the royal army, heightening the urgency of the Straw Hats' mission to stop the civil war.

events.title: Chaka Orders Royal Guards to Attack Rebels
events.description: Chaka, the acting captain of the royal guard in Igaram's absence, makes the difficult decision to order the royal guards to intercept and attack the approaching rebel army to protect Arabasta, despite knowing this will result in a bloody civil war.
events.significance: Shows the escalation of conflict in Arabasta and the desperation of the kingdom's defenders. Chaka's decision, though made with good intentions, plays into Crocodile's plan for civil war.

quotes.text: We must protect the kingdom at all costs. Prepare to intercept the rebels!
quotes.speaker: Chaka
quotes.context: Chaka ordering the royal guards to engage the rebel army

events.title: Vivi Breaks Free from Restraints
events.description: Despite being bound by ropes, Vivi manages to free herself from Crocodile's restraints. She immediately attempts to retrieve the key to the cage holding the Straw Hats and Smoker, showing her determination to save her friends and stop the rebellion.
events.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's resourcefulness and determination. Her escape sets the stage for the desperate attempt to retrieve the key from the Bananawani enclosure.

events.title: Crocodile Activates Flooding Trap
events.description: Crocodile reveals his deadly trap: he floods his VIP chamber at Rain Dinners with seawater, giving everyone trapped in the seastone cage exactly one hour to survive before they drown. The water slowly rises while the Bananawani guard the key to their escape.
events.significance: Creates extreme tension and a ticking clock scenario. The use of seawater neutralizes Devil Fruit users' abilities, making the Straw Hats completely helpless and dependent on rescue.

quotes.text: You have one hour. Enjoy your final moments.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile taunting the trapped prisoners as he activates the flooding mechanism

events.title: Bananawani Introduction
events.description: The fearsome Bananawani are introduced - giant crocodiles with banana-shaped growths on their heads that serve as Crocodile's pets. These creatures are revealed to be so powerful they can even prey on Sea Kings. One of them has swallowed the key to the prisoners' cage.
events.significance: Introduces a unique and dangerous creature type in the One Piece world. The Bananawani serve as both a physical obstacle and demonstrate Crocodile's control over fearsome beasts.

events.title: Vivi's Desperate Attempt to Retrieve the Key
events.description: Vivi desperately tries to retrieve the cage key from the Bananawani enclosure, risking her life to save the trapped Straw Hats and Smoker. Despite her best efforts, she cannot reach the key without being attacked by the massive predators.
events.significance: Shows Vivi's bravery and loyalty to the Straw Hats. Her willingness to risk her life for her friends deepens the emotional bond between Vivi and the crew.

quotes.text: I won't let you all die here! I have to get that key!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's determination to save her friends despite the danger

events.title: Mr. Prince Calls Crocodile
events.description: A mysterious caller identifying himself as 'Mr. Prince' contacts Crocodile via Den Den Mushi (transponder snail). The Straw Hats immediately recognize the voice as belonging to Sanji, who was not captured with the rest of the crew.
events.significance: Marks Sanji's clever plan to rescue his crewmates. The 'Mr. Prince' alias becomes an iconic moment for Sanji's character and, in retrospect, serves as unintentional foreshadowing of his royal heritage revealed hundreds of episodes later.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's first use of the Mr. Prince alias when calling Crocodile

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy and the crew recognizing Sanji's voice on the phone

events.title: The Mr. Prince Foreshadowing
events.description: Sanji's use of the alias 'Mr. Prince' appears to be a simple ruse at the time, but it unknowingly foreshadows his true identity as the third prince of the Germa Kingdom (Vinsmoke Sanji), which will be revealed over 700 episodes later during the Whole Cake Island Arc.
events.significance: One of the most remarkable examples of foreshadowing in One Piece. Whether intentional by Oda or coincidental, Sanji choosing specifically a 'prince' title takes on profound meaning when his royal heritage is later revealed.

events.title: Sanji Defeats Crocodile's Millions
events.description: Sanji, operating as 'Mr. Prince,' defeats all of Crocodile's Billions and Millions (low-ranking Baroque Works members) stationed at Rain Dinners, clearing the way for his rescue operation.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's combat prowess and tactical thinking. Shows he can handle multiple opponents while maintaining his cover and executing his plan.

events.title: Chopper's Decoy Mission
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper disguises himself as 'Mr. Prince' to serve as a decoy, luring Crocodile away from Rain Dinners. Despite the danger of facing one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, Chopper bravely leads Crocodile on a chase through Rainbase.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's courage and loyalty to his crew despite his timid nature. His willingness to risk his life against Crocodile demonstrates the depth of the Straw Hats' bonds.

events.title: Crocodile Leaves Rain Dinners
events.description: Crocodile, believing he's chasing the real 'Mr. Prince,' leaves Rain Dinners with Miss All Sunday (Nico Robin) to pursue the disguised Chopper. This is exactly what Sanji planned, removing the greatest threat from the casino.
events.significance: The success of Sanji's plan hinges on this moment. With Crocodile gone, Sanji has a window of opportunity to rescue the trapped crew members.

events.title: Sanji Destroys the Casino Bridge
events.description: Sanji destroys the bridge leading to Rain Dinners, preventing Baroque Works agents from entering the casino and interfering with the rescue operation. This also traps Vivi inside temporarily, but Sanji explains this is to keep enemies out while he saves everyone.
events.significance: Shows Sanji's tactical thinking - he's willing to make difficult decisions that might seem to endanger allies in the short term for a greater strategic advantage. The destroyed bridge buys crucial time for the rescue.

quotes.text: I didn't do it to trap you inside, Vivi-chan. I did it to keep them out.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji explaining his strategy to Vivi after destroying the bridge

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's iconic line when calling Crocodile

quotes.text: You have one hour. Enjoy your final moments.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

quotes.text: I won't let you all die here! I have to get that key!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi's determination to save the Straw Hats

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Recognizing Sanji's voice as Mr. Prince

themes.description: Multiple characters risk their lives for others in this episode - Vivi attempts to retrieve the key despite the Bananawani, Chopper serves as a decoy against Crocodile, and Sanji orchestrates a dangerous rescue operation.
themes.symbolism: The flooding chamber represents the crew's dire situation, while Sanji and Chopper working outside the cage symbolize hope and the power of teamwork.

themes.description: Sanji demonstrates that cleverness and strategy can overcome seemingly insurmountable obstacles. Rather than confronting Crocodile directly, he uses deception and tactics to outmaneuver the Warlord.
themes.symbolism: The 'Mr. Prince' alias represents Sanji's ability to create an alternative identity and narrative to achieve his goals.

themes.description: The civil war in Arabasta reaches a critical point as both the rebel army and royal guards prepare for battle, unaware they're both victims of Crocodile's manipulation.
themes.symbolism: The approaching armies represent the tragedy of conflict based on misinformation and manipulation.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji shows his tactical brilliance and selflessness by orchestrating a complex rescue operation. His 'Mr. Prince' persona demonstrates his ability to think creatively under pressure.
keyActions: Creates the 'Mr. Prince' alias and calls Crocodile
Defeats all Baroque Works Millions at Rain Dinners
Destroys the casino bridge to prevent enemy interference
Coordinates with Chopper to lure Crocodile away
quotes: I didn't do it to trap you inside, Vivi-chan. I did it to keep them out.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi's desperation and determination are on full display as she risks her life to save the Straw Hats, demonstrating her growth from a sheltered princess to a courageous ally.
keyActions: Attempts to retrieve the key from the Bananawani enclosure
Refuses to give up despite overwhelming danger
quotes: I won't let you all die here! I have to get that key!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite his timid nature, Chopper shows tremendous courage by disguising himself as Mr. Prince to distract Crocodile, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.
keyActions: Successfully lures Crocodile away from Rain Dinners
Risks his life to buy time for the rescue operation

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile's arrogance is displayed as he leaves his prisoners to drown in his trap, confident in his victory. However, his underestimation of the Straw Hats' resourcefulness leads him into Sanji's trap.
keyActions: Activates the flooding trap at Rain Dinners
Pursues the disguised Chopper, leaving his base vulnerable
quotes: You have one hour. Enjoy your final moments.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some scenes for dramatic effect, particularly Vivi's attempts to reach the key and the tension of the flooding chamber. The manga covers the same events more quickly.
Some dialogue and internal monologue is expanded in the anime to fill the episode runtime and build suspense.

trivia.fact: The 'Mr. Prince' alias chosen by Sanji in this episode is considered one of the most remarkable instances of foreshadowing in One Piece, as Sanji is later revealed to be an actual prince (third prince of the Germa Kingdom) during the Whole Cake Island Arc, over 700 episodes later.
Bananawani are described as being so powerful they can prey on Sea Kings, making them one of the few known natural predators of Sea Kings in the One Piece world.
This episode aired on April 21, 2002 in Japan and received a 14.6% TV rating, ranking #5 in viewership for that week.
The episode was directed by Harume Kosaka with screenplay by Michiru Shimada and animation supervised by Hideaki Naniwa.
The ending theme 'GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara-' by Takako Uehara peaked at #15 on the Oricon single chart and was specifically used for the Arabasta Arc episodes.

sources.title: GLORY -Kimi ga Iru Kara- - One Piece Wiki
